title: The Sabbath Year and Year of Jubilee
summary: Leviticus 25 introduces the Sabbath Year (every 7 years) and the Year of Jubilee (every 50 years). These times were for rest, restoration, and releaseâ€”land returned to original owners and slaves were freed.

faq.question: What was the Year of Jubilee?
faq.answer: A special year every 50 years when debts were forgiven, land was returned, and slaves were set free.

faq.question: Why were these years important?
faq.answer: They emphasized God's ownership of the land and promoted justice, mercy, and rest.
